alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 6:06AM EST until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...River Flooding is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following county, Sussex. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding is occurring along the Nottoway River at Stony Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 602 AM EST, the Nottoway River at Stony Creek is cresting after recent heavy rainfall. The river remains above minor flood stage and will start to fall later today. It will then fall below flood stage tonight. - For Nottoway River at Stony Creek: At 5:30am the stage was 16.36 feet. Flood Stage is 15.0 feet. Forecast: The river is cresting, and will slowly fall later today. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
